params.name: index
params.description: [Number] Index of the child to be returned

item.description: Returns a child based on an index

params.name: child
params.description: <Widget|Object> The Widget instance, or configuration object for the Widget to be added as a child

params.name: index
params.description: <Number> (Optional.) Number representing the position at which the child should be inserted

add.description: Adds a Widget as a child. If the specified Widget already has a parent it will be removed from its current parent before being added as a child

params.name: child
params.description: The child widget or its index

params.name: fn
params.description: Callback

each.description: Iterates through all this widget children

selection.description: Returns the currently selected child Widget. If the mulitple attribte is set to true will return an Y.ArrayList instance containing the currently selected children. If no children are selected, will return null

multiple.description: Boolean indicating if multiple children can be selected at once. Whether or not multiple selection is enabled is always delegated to the value of the multiple attribute of the root widget in the object hierarchy

childType.description: Constructor reference to the default type of the children managed by this Widget. The default value is taken from defaultChildType

defaultChildType.description: default value used when a childType is not provided. This attribute is used mostly by classes using WidgetParent.

selectedIndex.description: The index of the currently selected item

children.description: An array of instances or configuration objects representing the widget's children

childrenContainer.description: The node inside which to insert the children

WidgetParent.description: A widget extension that makes the current widget contein child widgets

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: A Checkbox
A collection of DOM Nodes

offsetParent.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the offset parents of this one

contentDoc.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the documents of all the nodes in the collection that are Iframes

height.description: Gets/sets the height of all the nodes in the collection

toggle.description: If a node in the collection is hidden, it shows it. If it is visible, it hides it.

params.name: value
params.description: - optional

value.description: Sets or returns the value of the node. Useful mostly for form elements

ready.description: Executes a callback when the DOM to which the first node in the collection belongs is ready

params.name: duration
params.description: The duration in ms or "fast", "normal", or "slow"

params.name: easing
params.description: A predefined easing function ("linear", "easein", "easeout", "sling") or a custom easing function

params.name: callback
params.description: Executes when the animation is complete

animate.description: Animates all members of the node list. Requires the Anim module

eq.description: Returns a new NodeList with the nth element of the current list

find.description: Finds all the nodes below the ones in the current collection that match the search query

append.description: Appends nodes to the ones in the current node list

size.description: Returns the length of this NodeList

filter.description: Returns a new nodelist with only the nodes for which the provided function returns true

parent.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the parents of the current nodes

params.name: duration
params.description: The duration in ms or "fast", "normal", or "slow"

params.name: easing
params.description: A predefined easing function ("linear", "easein", "easeout", "sling") or a custom easing function

params.name: callback
params.description: Executes when the animation is complete

slideUp.description: Causes all nodes to slide up, changing their height and setting their overflow to hidden for the duration of the animation. Requires the Anim module

next.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the next siblings of the nodes in the collection

setClass.description: Sets the class name of all nodes in the collection

width.description: Gets/sets the width of all the nodes in the collection

appendTo.description: Appends all nodes in the current collection to the target node

params.name: duration
params.description: The duration in ms or "fast", "normal", or "slow"

params.name: easing
params.description: A predefined easing function ("linear", "easein", "easeout", "sling") or a custom easing function

params.name: callback
params.description: Executes when the animation is complete

fadeIn.description: Causes all nodes to fade in. Requires the Anim module

toggleClass.description: Adds/removes a certain class from all nodes in the collection

previous.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the previous siblings of the nodes in the collection

inDoc.description: Returns whether the first node in this NodeList is inserted in the document

addClass.description:
Adds a number of classes to all nodes in the collection
Takes multiple string parameters

map.description:
Iterates through the nodelist, returning a new nodelist with all the elements
return by the callback function

insertBefore.description: Inserts all nodes in the current node list before the target node

params.name: duration
params.description: The duration in ms or "fast", "normal", or "slow"

params.name: easing
params.description: A predefined easing function ("linear", "easein", "easeout", "sling") or a custom easing function

params.name: callback
params.description: Executes when the animation is complete

fadeOut.description: Causes all nodes to fade out. Requires the Anim module

params.name: deep
params.description: If true all nodes in the brach are cloned. If not, only the ones in the collection

clone.description: Returns a new NodeList with all nodes cloned from the current one

removeClass.description:
Removes a number of classes from all nodes in the collection.
Takes multiple string parameters

stop.description: Makes the current animation for this nodelist stop. Requires the Anim module

unbind.description: Removes an event listener from all the nodes

link.description:
Returns a new NodeList containing all the nodes in the current list and the ones in the new one
Useful for applying properties to a bigger group of nodes, while keeping the original references

offset.description:
Returns an object literal containing:
  • top: top position in px
  • left: left position in px
  • width: width in px
  • height: height in px

detach.description: Removes all the nodes from the DOM tree. Unline remove(), it keeps all event listeners

params.name: duration
params.description: The duration in ms or "fast", "normal", or "slow"

params.name: easing
params.description: A predefined easing function ("linear", "easein", "easeout", "sling") or a custom easing function

params.name: callback
params.description: Executes when the animation is complete

slideDown.description: Causes all nodes to slide down, changing their height and setting their overflow to hidden for the duration of the animation. Requires the Anim module

setContent.description: Sets the innerHTML of the nodelist by safely removing all children first

on.description: Adds an event listener to all the nods in the list

prependTo.description: Inserts all nodes in the current collection before the first child of the target node

unbindAll.description:
Removes all event listeners from all the current nodes
If "crawl" is true, it also removes them from all the nodes in the branches defined by the nodes

attr.description: Gets or sets tag attributes to the nodes in the collection

params.name: filter
params.description: Return only the children that match the tag or index in this parameter

children.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the children of the current nodes

html.description: Gets or sets the innerHTML of all the nodes in the node list

remove.description: Removes all the nodes from the DOM tree and removes all event listeners from the nodes

params.name: duration
params.description: The duration in ms or "fast", "normal", or "slow"

params.name: easing
params.description: A predefined easing function ("linear", "easein", "easeout", "sling") or a custom easing function

params.name: callback
params.description: Executes when the animation is complete

fadeToggle.description: Causes all nodes to fade in or out. Requires the Anim module

currentStyle.description: Returns the computed style of the first node in the collection

each.description:
Iterates through the NodeList The callback is passed a reference to the node and an iteration index. The "this" keyword also refers to the node. ie:
$("div").each(function (node, i) {
    if (i % 2 == 1) {
        $(node).addClass("even");
    } else {
        $(node).addClass("odd");
    }
});

hasClass.description: Returns true if the first node in the collection has the className CSS class

first.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the first children of the nodes in the collection

xsl.description: Makes a XSL transformation. Loads the files with Ajax if needed. Requires the io-xsl submodule

flajax.description: Makes a cross-domain ajax call based on a Flash engine. Requires the io-xsl submodule

initialize.description: Initialize our DHTML history. You must call this after the page is finished loading

params.name: newLocation
params.description:
required - This will be the #hash value in the URL. Users can bookmark it. It will persist across sessions, so
your application should be able to restore itself to a specific state based on just this value. It
should be either a simple keyword for a viewstate or else a pseudo-querystring.

params.name: historyData
params.description:
optional - This is for complex data that is relevant only to the current browsing session. It will be available
to your application until the browser is closed. If the user comes back to a bookmarked history point
during a later session, this data will no longer be available. Don't rely on it for application
re-initialization from a bookmark.

params.name: historyData.newTitle
params.description: optional - This will swap out the html </code> attribute with a new value. If you have set a baseTitle using the options bundle, the value will be plugged into the baseTitle by swapping out the @@@ replacement param.

baseTitle.description: pattern for title changes. Example: "Armchair DJ [@@@]" - @@@ will be replaced

firstLoad.description: Whether this is the first time the History loaded or not

blankURL.description:
URL for the blank html file we use for IE; can be overridden via the options bundle. 
Otherwise it must be served in same directory as this library

encodeURI.description: Whether to encode the URI or not

responseSchema.description:
The schema by which to parse the response data. May be:

DataSource.responseType.JSARRAY schema
A JSARRAY response type assumes the following response shape:

//All records are listed as an array
[
    ['value1', 'value2', 'value3'], //one record
    ['another1', 'another2', 'another3'] //another record
]

DataSource.responseType.TEXT schema
This schema essentially splits the string and then acts as if it where a DataSource.responseType.JSARRAY.
Must define a fieldDelim property. Example (comma separated value):

responseSchema: {
    fieldDelim: ","
    fields: ["firstField", "secondField"]
}

DataSource.responseType.JSON schema
Example:

responseSchema = {
    resultList : "Response.Results", // String pointer to result data
    // Field order doesn't matter and not all data is required to have a field
    fields : [
        { key: "id" }, // simple location
        { key: "obj" }
    ]
}

DataSource.responseType.XML schema
Example:

responseSchema: {
    resultNode: "rootNode", // every result field will be looked for between this node's children
    fields: [
        { key: "keyName", node: "nodeName" }, // in this case, the value of the field will be the node's value
       { key: "otherKey", node: "otherNode", attr: "type" }, // in this other case, the field value will be the "type" attribute
        { key: "aNumber", node: "someNode", parser: "parseFloat" } // this value will be parsed as a Float
    ]
}
